unnormalised: Hey Social Media Peeps! Ever wondered what makes stuff go viral these days? The virality trend is constantly shifting faster than a Delhi auto!
normalised: Hey Social Media Peeps! Ever wondered what makes stuff go viral these days? The virality trend is constantly shifting faster than a Delhi auto!

unnormalised: Remember that quirky dance reel inspired by a Bollywood song that swept across Insta last week? Or how everyone was suddenly making Dalgona coffee during the lockdown? Virality is a fickle beast.
normalised: Remember that quirky dance reel inspired by a Bollywood song that swept across Insta last week? Or how everyone was suddenly making Dalgona coffee during the lockdown? Virality is a fickle beast.

unnormalised: Right now, short, snappy videos featuring relatable everyday situations are HUGE. Think slice-of-life skits shot in Chandni Chowk. Also, anything involving food, especially around festival time, is golden. I'm talking perfect Onam Sadhya plating videos, mouthwatering biryani recipes, you name it!
normalised: Right now, short, snappy videos featuring relatable everyday situations are huge. Think slice-of-life skits shot in Chandni Chowk. Also, anything involving food, especially around festival time, is golden. I'm talking perfect Onam Sadhya plating videos, mouthwatering biryani recipes, you name it!

unnormalised: Influencer marketing is key here, of course. Collaborations between big creators and smaller, niche accounts can really amplify reach. But authenticity reigns supreme – people can spot a fake endorsement from 10 km away.
normalised: Influencer marketing is key here, of course. Collaborations between big creators and smaller, niche accounts can really amplify reach. But authenticity reigns supreme – people can spot a fake endorsement from ten kilometer away.

unnormalised: Brands are also catching on, trying to inject humor and local flavour into their campaigns. Even IIM Ahmedabad is using quirky reels to attract students! The goal? To become the next viral sensation! But remember, chasing virality isn't a sustainable strategy; building genuine connection is!
normalised: Brands are also catching on, trying to inject humor and local flavour into their campaigns. Even I I M Ahmedabad is using quirky reels to attract students! The goal? To become the next viral sensation! But remember, chasing virality isn't a sustainable strategy; building genuine connection is!
